senselogic.sitevision.api.date

Interface DateUtil


  • @Requireable(value="DateUtil")
public interface DateUtil
    Date utility interface.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getDateUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 3.5
    Author:
    Albin Ã–hrn

    • Method Detail

      • getDateAsISO8601String

        String getDateAsISO8601String(Date aDate)
        Formats a date according to the ISO8601 specification.

        An example: A date representing february 3, 2001 at 04:45 in an +1h UTC timezone offset would be ISO8601 formatted as 2001-02-03T04:05+01:00.

        Parameters:
        aDate - a Date that needs to be formatted
        Returns:
        the date formatted as a ISO8601 string, or null if aDate is null

      • getCalendarAsISO8601String

        String getCalendarAsISO8601String(Calendar aCalendar)
        Formats a calendar according to the ISO8601 specification.

        An example: A calendar representing february 3, 2001 at 04:45 in an +1h UTC timezone offset would be ISO8601 formatted as 2001-02-03T04:05+01:00.

        Parameters:
        aCalendar - a Calendar that needs to be formatted
        Returns:
        aString the calendar date formatted as a ISO8601 string, or null if aCalendar is null

      • getEditorFormatPattern

        String getEditorFormatPattern(Locale aLocale)
        Gets the date format pattern used in the Sitevision editor for a specific Locale.
        Parameters:
        aLocale - the Locale that specifies the date format pattern
        Returns:
        the date format pattern used in the Sitevision editor that corresponds to aLocale. If aLocale is null then the current locale (as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentLocale()) is used to locate the format pattern. If no pattern exist for aLocale then the pattern that corresponds to Locale.ENGLISH will be returned.

      • getDateAsString

        String getDateAsString(String aFormatPattern,
                       Date aDate)
        Formats a Date according to a SimpleDateFormat pattern.

        Note! The current locale as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentLocale() will be used. If current locale is unavailable, Locale.getDefault() will be used.

        Parameters:
        aFormatPattern - date to string pattern according to SimpleDateFormat. Default pattern will be used if aFormatPattern is null or blank
        aDate - the Date
        Returns:
        returns a String representation of aDate according to aFormatPattern (and resolved Locale). Returns null if formatting fails or aDate is null
        See Also:
        getDateAsString(String, Date, Locale)

      • getDateAsString

        String getDateAsString(String aFormatPattern,
                       Date aDate,
                       Locale aLocale)
        Formats a Date according to a SimpleDateFormat pattern using a given Locale.
        Parameters:
        aFormatPattern - date to string pattern according to SimpleDateFormat. Default pattern will be used if aFormatPattern is null or blank
        aDate - the Date
        aLocale - the Locale
        Returns:
        returns a String representation of aDate according to aFormatPattern (and resolved Locale). Returns null if formatting fails or aDate or aLocale is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 8.2

      • getCalendarAsString

        String getCalendarAsString(String aFormatPattern,
                           Calendar aCalendar)
        Formats the date of a Calendar according to a SimpleDateFormat pattern.

        Note! The current locale as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentLocale() will be used. If current locale is unavailable, Locale.getDefault() will be used.

        Parameters:
        aFormatPattern - date to string pattern according to SimpleDateFormat. Default pattern will be used if aFormatPattern is null or blank
        aCalendar - the Calendar
        Returns:
        returns a String representation of aCalendar according to aFormatPattern (and resolved Locale). Returns null if formatting fails or aCalendar is null
        See Also:
        getCalendarAsString(String, Calendar, Locale)

      • getCalendarAsString

        String getCalendarAsString(String aFormatPattern,
                           Calendar aCalendar,
                           Locale aLocale)
        Formats the date of a Calendar according to a SimpleDateFormat pattern and a given Locale.
        Parameters:
        aFormatPattern - date to string pattern according to SimpleDateFormat. Default pattern will be used if aFormatPattern is null or blank
        aCalendar - the Calendar
        aLocale - the Locale
        Returns:
        returns a String representation of aCalendar according to aFormatPattern (and resolved Locale). Returns null if formatting fails or aCalendar or aLocale is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 8.2

      • toCalendar

        Calendar toCalendar(Date aDate)
        Converts a Date to a Calendar.
        Parameters:
        aDate - a Date
        Returns:
        a Calendar representing aDate, or null if aDate is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.5

      • toDate

        Date toDate(Calendar aCalendar)
        Converts a Calendar to a Date.
        Parameters:
        aCalendar - a Calendar
        Returns:
        a Date representing aCalendar, or null if aCalendar is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.5

      • parseDate

        Date parseDate(String aDateStr,
               String aFormatPattern)
        Converts a date string to a Date using a SimpleDateFormat pattern.

        Note! The current locale as of PortletContextUtil.getCurrentLocale() will be used. If current locale is unavailable, Locale.getDefault() will be used.

        Parameters:
        aDateStr - the string representation of a Date
        aFormatPattern - string to date pattern according to SimpleDateFormat
        Returns:
        a Date representation of aDateStr, or null if parsing fails or any method argument (aDateStr, aFormatPattern) is null or blank
        Since:
        Sitevision 5.1
        See Also:
        parseDate(String, String, Locale)

      • parseDate

        Date parseDate(String aDateStr,
               String aFormatPattern,
               Locale aLocale)
        Converts a date string to a Date using a SimpleDateFormat pattern and a given Locale.
        Parameters:
        aDateStr - the string representation of a Date
        aFormatPattern - string to date pattern according to SimpleDateFormat
        aLocale - the Locale
        Returns:
        a Date representation of aDateStr, or null if parsing fails or any method argument (aDateStr, aFormatPattern, aLocale) is null or blank
        Since:
        Sitevision 8.2

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
